|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS32 |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 264 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = Parallel |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Eon;EN29LV320T-70TCP; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = 3801088 bytes |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 16 |ram1chip = SK hynix;HY5DU281622FTP-5; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = 32 |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Broadcom;BCM5325F;BCM5325FKQMG RG0646 P11 802936 1A; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3/3u |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = Yes |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:18:F8 |oui = 00:18:F8 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = CFE;;; |stockos = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = CyberTAN |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT, OpenWrt |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 12/11/2006 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 6.7" x 5.9" x 1.4" |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4321;BCM4321LKFBG UN0722 P21 824300 N3 |rad1chip2 = Broadcom;BCM2055;BCM2055KFB6 HE0719 P20 822522 N3 |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = External Fixed |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 11 |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== WRT150N v1.0 serial numbers appear to start with '''CQ60'''. "3763-14142501R" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. ==Links of Interest== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Linksys_WRT150N_%26_WRT160N On the DD-WRT wiki] * VLANs don't work [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=188606#188606 per Eko] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linksys_routers Listed on the 'Linksys routers' page on Wikipedia] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== {{DDWRTNotice|microno}} #Read the [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=51486 Peacock Announcement] #Download THIS Newd_Mini file. ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/V24_TNG/svn12548/dd-wrt.v24-12548_NEWD_mini.bin. #Ensure you have a physical ethernet connection to your router, and disable your wireless adapter, antivirus/firewall protection, and any software that makes strong use of your network (BitTorrent, Streaming Audio/Video, etc). #Perform a [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/Hard_reset_or_30/30/30|hard 30/30/30]] reset. #Navigate to http://192.168.1.1/ in your web browser of choice. #Enter no username, and the password "admin". #Go to the administration tab. Click on firmware upgrade. #Browse to the .bin file you downloaded in step 2 #Click on the upgrade button and WAIT for the upgrade successful message. #Power cycle your router. Wait until you can see the DD-WRT password screen at [http://192.168.1.1/]. #Perform another [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/Hard_reset_or_30/30/30|30/30/30]] reset on your router. Wait until you can see the password screen at [http://192.168.1.1/]. #Set a new username and password, and continue on to configure your router like normal. You can now upgrade to any generic DD-WRT build except Mega and Micro. Be sure to always do a hard reset prior to flashing another build, do a power cycle followed by another hard reset after flashing, and NEVER re-use a configuration file from a previous build or another router. Always reconfigure from scratch. ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|notrecommended}} {{OpenWrtNotice|insufficient}} {{OpenWrtNotice|endsupport|2022|19.07.10}} {{OpenWrtNotice|broadcomwifi}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/linksys/linksys_wrt150n_v1 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrt150n |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = 10.03 |current_supported_version = 10.03.1 |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==Upgrading== {{Upgrade dd-wrt}} ==Pictures==
'''FCCID {{fccid|Q87-WRT150N}}''' File:Linksys WRT150N v1.0 FCC 01.jpg| File:Linksys WRT150N v1.0 FCC 02.jpg| File:Linksys WRT150N v1.0 FCC 03.jpg| File:Linksys WRT150N v1.0 FCC 04.jpg| File:Linksys WRT150N v1.0 FCC 05.jpg| File:Linksys WRT150N v1.0 FCC 06.jpg|
[[Has images::fcc| ]] ==Notes== =====Security LED===== * [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=67102 (solved) Security LED Script WRT300n v1.1] * The security LED will not light up after flashing on version 1.1. To fix this, go to '''Administration > Commands''', type in the following and then click '''Save Startup''': while sleep 1; do if [ `nvram get wl0_security_mode` = "disabled" ]; then gpio enable 3; else gpio disable 3; fi; done & As [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=489471#489471 posted] by osmosis On the wiki for 150N is posted root@DD-WRT:~# gpio enable 5 #(SECURITY LED - off - green) root@DD-WRT:~# gpio disable 5 #(SECURITY LED - on - green) root@DD-WRT:~# gpio disable 3 #(SECURITY LED - on - amber) root@DD-WRT:~# gpio enable 3 #(SECURITY LED - off - amber) this applies for the [[Linksys WRT300N v1.0|WRT300Nv1.0]] as well so to incorporate the amber into the mix as not secure: Also confirmed working on the WRT300N v1.1 [[User:WifiShadow|WifiShadow]] 02:40, October 1, 2010 (UTC) while sleep 1; do if [ `nvram get wl0_security_mode` = "disabled" ]; then gpio enable 5 gpio disable 3 else gpio enable 3 gpio disable 5 fi done & [[Category:English Documentation]]
